intro: Urginea pretoriensis, commonly known as the Pretoria bulb, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its large, fleshy underground bulb. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is adapted to arid environments and can survive periods of drought. The bulb is also used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in gardens.
